channel.title: I Need Help with Environmental Variables
channel.description: I am using windows xp and I can't edit the system variables, which means i can't edit Classpath or path. Could someone plz help.

item.title: I Need Help with Environmental Variables
item.dc:creator: @Pjgman569 Pjgman569
item.description:
@Pjgman569 wrote:

Hey thanks man I’ll try this out and tell you if it works.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 17, 2009, 10:20:06 pm[/size][hr]Well I have a new problem now i can edit the stuff but the Java I am downloading is Jre not JDK. So that means the server wont work. Oh ya and the Java download says that its is jdk but it really isn’t. And could someone tell me what to put in the class path and path variables.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 17, 2009, 10:25:39 pm[/size][hr]Someone Help Plz

Read full topic

item.title: I Need Help with Environmental Variables
item.dc:creator: @Pjgman569 Pjgman569
item.description:
@Pjgman569 wrote:

That’s not the problem. I can get to it but I can’t edit it. All the system variables are gray and unclickable so are the buttons below. Thanks you for posting but it is no what I am looking for. If someone else can help me with this problem please post.

Read full topic

item.title: I Need Help with Environmental Variables
item.dc:creator: @Sneaky1 Sneaky_
item.description:
@Sneaky1 wrote:

My computer => View system information => Advanced => Environment Variables

Sorry if I’m wrong but isn’t this what you need?

Regards,
Sneaky_

Read full topic
